name: Introduction to Gender and Sexuality Studies
description: This course provides an introduction to the study of gender and sexuality through a critical examination of multiple interlocking systems of power. It covers topics such as gender roles and identities, the social construction of gender and sexuality, and the intersection of gender, sexuality, and other social identities. The course also examines the impact of gender and sexuality on social institutions such as the family, education, politics, and the economy.

name: Gender and Sexuality in the Media
description: This course is an analysis of the representation of gender and sexuality in the media. It examines how gender and sexuality are portrayed in various cultural contexts and the role of media in constructing and perpetuating gender and sexual identities. Topics include gender in television, film, magazines, and advertising, as well as the implications of these representations for individuals and society.

name: Gender and Sexuality in History
description: This course explores the history of gender and sexuality in various world cultures. It examines the ways in which gender and sexual identities have been constructed and expressed in different societies throughout history, and how these identities have been shaped by power, religion, and other social forces. The course also covers the impact of gender and sexuality on politics, culture, and social movements.

name: Queer Theory and Practice
description: This course examines the theories and practices of queer studies and activism. It covers topics such as queer theory, queer politics, identity formation, and the representation of queer people in the media. The course also examines the intersections of gender, sexuality, race, class, and other identities, and the implications for activism and social change.
prerequisites: Introduction to Gender and Sexuality Studies
Gender and Sexuality in the Media

name: Two-Spirit Studies
description: This course examines the history, culture, and politics of two-spirit people in North America. Topics include the construction of two-spirit identities, the representation of two-spirit people in the media, and the impact of colonialism and heterosexism on two-spirit people. The course also examines the role of two-spirit people in Indigenous cultures and the implications for contemporary two-spirit activism.
prerequisites: Introduction to Gender and Sexuality Studies
Gender and Sexuality in the Media
